A federal grand jury filed criminal charges against five Chinese military officials accused of hacking into private - sector U.S. companies , including U.S. Steel , to gain trade secrets , according to an indictment unsealed Monday .

The indictment accused members of the People 's Liberation Army , the military of the People 's Republic of China , of participating in cyber - espionage on behalf of a foreign government , according to the 48 - page indictment .
